(2011) | Misc = {{Singles | Name = War Is the Answer | Type = studio | single 1 = [[Hard to See]] | single 1 date = July 21, 2009 | single 2 = [[Walk Away (Five Finger Death Punch song)|Walk Away]] | single 2 date = November 2, 2009 | single 3 = [[Dying Breed (song)|Dying Breed]] | single 3 date = November 16, 2009 | single 4 = [[No One Gets Left Behind]] | single 4 date = March 8, 2010 | single 5 = [[Bad Company (song)#Five Finger Death Punch cover|Bad Company]] | single 5 date = May 17, 2010 | single 6 = [[Far from Home (song)|Far from Home]] | single 6 date = September 16, 2010 }} {{Extra album cover | Upper caption = Deluxe edition cover | Type = studio | Cover = | Lower caption = Cover for the deluxe edition of ''War Is the Answer''. }} }} '''''War Is the Answer''''' is the second studio album by American [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] band [[Five Finger Death Punch]]. It was released on September 22, 2009 through Prospect Park Records. The album debuted at number 7 on the [[Billboard 200]] selling approximately 44,000 copies in its first week. It is also their last album to feature bassist Matt Snell who was released from the band in late 2010 and announced in 2011.{{cite news| url=http://www.nytimes.com/2009/10/01/arts/music/01arts-PEARLJAMISNO_BRF.html | work=The New York Times | title=Pearl Jam Is No. 1 | first=Dave | last=Itzkoff | date=October 1, 2009 | accessdate=May 27, 2010}} "War Is the Answer" has been certified gold for U.S.,{{cite web|url= http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=153514|title= Five Finger Death Punch To Host Second Annual 'Love Songs For Tough Guys' Special|work= Blabbermouth.net|publisher= Roadrunner Records|accessdate= March 10, 2011}} with sales of 569,000.{{cite web|url= http://www.billboard.com/news/evanescence-lauren-alaina-targeting-billboard-1005412352.story#/news/evanescence-lauren-alaina-targeting-billboard-1005412352.story |title= Evanescence, Lauren Alaina Targeting Billboard 200 Top 10 |publisher= Billboard.co|accessdate= October 16, 2011}} ==Writing and recording== ''War Is the Answer'' was announced as Five Finger Death Punch's second studio album in May 2009. The album was produced by Kevin Churko, who had previously produced [[Ozzy Osbourne]]'s ''[[Black Rain (Ozzy Osbourne album)|Black Rain]]'', and mixed by [[Randy Staub]], who has previously worked with [[Metallica]] and [[Stone Sour]].{{cite web|url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/BLABBERMOUTH.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=120574|title=Five Finger Death Punch Guitarist Discusses Upcoming Album|work=[[Blabbermouth.net]]|publisher=[[Roadrunner Records]]|accessdate=August 1, 2009}} Guitarist Zoltan Bathory commented on the style of the album, stating "we've continued the journey we started on the first album, so there's a healthy balance of melody and aggression, and as always we concentrated on writing strong metal songs in the traditional sense." Bathory explained to ''[[Metal Hammer]]'' about the album title, "It's a phrase we've had up our sleeves for some time, and I've been talking about it a lot in interviews. In fact, somebody just asked me: 'If war is the answer, then what is the question?', and I guess the answer to that is "the meaning of life!" Because life IS war. Basically, you're fighting against one thing or another right from the start â you're fighting for survival with pretty much everything against you, you're fighting for social or political positions"{{cite web|url=http://www.songfacts.com/detail.php?id=16964|title=War Is The Answer Songfacts|work=Songfacts|accessdate=October 5, 2010}} ==Release== Although ''War Is the Answer'' was originally announced to be released on June 8, 2009, it was pushed back to October 6, 2009, then pulled forward to September 22, 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/BLABBERMOUTH.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=124436|title=Five Finger Death Punch Guitarist Interviewed On Australia's 'The Racket'; Audio Available|work=Blabbermouth.net|publisher=Roadrunner Records|accessdate=August 1, 2009}} On August 10, 2009, they announced the first leg of their Shock and Raw Tour, which will promote the new album. The second leg was announced on August 17, 2009. The two bonus tracks, "[[Succubus (song)|Succubus]]" and "Undone" were originally cut from their first album ''The Way of the Fist''. A demo version of "Succubus" was leaked onto the Internet under the title "Hate Me". The first single from ''War Is the Answer'', "Hard to See", began receiving radio play on July 13, 2009. The song was noted for having "undeniable melodies." According to Bathory, the song is about people being attached to opinions based on limited amounts of information.{{cite web|url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/BLABBERMOUTH.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=123431|title=Five Finger Death Punch: New Single Available For Streaming|work=Blabbermouth.net|publisher=Roadrunner Records|accessdate=August 1, 2009}} It is also a playable track in the [[rhythm video game]] [[Guitar Hero: Warriors of Rock]]. The second single, "[[Walk Away (Five Finger Death Punch song)|Walk Away]]" was released on November 2, 2009 and appeared in Tap Tap Revenge 3 as one of their weekly free tracks and also was used as the theme song for [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling|TNA]]'s 2010 PPV [[Lockdown (2010)|Lockdown]]. The next two singles, "[[Dying Breed (song)|Dying Breed]]" released on November 16, 2009{{cite web|url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=129692|title=FIVE FINGER DEATH PUNCH To Release 'Dying Breed' Digital Single|work=Blabbermouth.net|publisher=Roadrunner Records|accessdate=April 18, 2010}} and "[[No One Gets Left Behind]]" released on March 8, 2010{{cite web|url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=135011|title=FIVE FINGER DEATH PUNCH To Release New Single; New Mic Stand Unveiled|work=Blabbermouth.net|publisher=Roadrunner Records|accessdate=April 18, 2010}} were both released exclusively in the United Kingdom. They released their cover of [[Bad Company]]'s song, "[[Bad Company (song)#Five Finger Death Punch cover|Bad Company]]" as the fifth single on May 17, 2010.
